decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly generating red mana through spells like Manamorphose and Pyretic Ritual to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The goal is to chain together spells to create a storm of spells, generating massive amounts of mana and drawing through the deck with cards like Reckless Impulse and Wish. The main win condition is using the storm count to deal lethal damage with Flame of Anor or to recur key spells with Past in Flames. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, using cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. It includes a mix of blue, black, and white cards for control and removal, as well as combo pieces like Goryo's Vengeance and Quantum Riddler to facilitate instant reanimation. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and utilizing cheap, efficient spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of burn spells, aggressive creatures, and cantrips to maintain card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. It aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of direct damage and aggressive creatures. The deck also includes some flexibility with reactive spells like Mutagenic Growth and Unholy Heat to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on using creature toolbox cards to assemble combos that generate value and disrupt opponents. It includes a combination of creatures that can be searched for with Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling, as well as cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Malevolent Rumble that have synergy with the deck's strategy. Additionally, cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Endurance provide versatility and resilience against different types of opponents. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents through efficient creature interactions and combo potential.

This deck focuses on a quick aggressive strategy while also disrupting the opponent's plans with cards that tax their resources. Utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phelia, alongside removal spells like Solitude and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's plays, while Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck's blend of aggro and disruption makes it a versatile and challenging opponent to face.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer. It also includes card advantage engines like Teferi, Time Raveler and Snapcaster Mage to outvalue opponents. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats of its own to eventually overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of utility lands and versatile spells to adapt to different matchups and situations.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, using cards like Faithless Looting and Persist. By then utilizing reanimation spells like Unearth and Gran-Gran, the deck aims to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a quick and explosive finish. This strategy combines the elements of card advantage, graveyard manipulation, and explosive creature plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces to generate a large amount of mana with cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, while utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw through the deck quickly. Once a critical mass of spells has been cast, Past in Flames can be used to recast them all from the graveyard before finishing off the opponent with a large Grapeshot or using Wish to search for the needed win condition. The key is to chain spells together efficiently to overwhelm the opponent in a burst of powerful combo plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outlast opponents. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the board and draw cards. The deck also includes win conditions like Solitude and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats efficiently. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter provides additional value by allowing the player to cast spells repeatedly. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board control, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and win through efficient removal and card advantage.

This deck focuses on assembling the Tron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to control the game through powerful threats and disruption spells while utilizing the Tron lands to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. It also includes cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to generate card advantage. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining advantage and eventually taking control of the game. The deck is built to be versatile and adaptable to different strategies, with a mix of efficient removal, card draw, and disruption spells. It aims to out-value and outlast opponents through efficient play and resource management.

This deck revolves around quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo, utilizing cards like Neoform, Eldritch Evolution, and Summoner's Pact to search for and put an Allosaurus Rider onto the battlefield. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand to quickly close out games. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Planar Genesis and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect the combo and ensure its success. The deck also has various control elements like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It also aims to control the board with removal like Solitude and Consign to Memory. Additionally, the deck includes powerful card draw and manipulation tools like Arena of Glory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to ensure consistent performance and outvalue the opponent. By combining aggression and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victories.

The deck focuses on putting together powerful combinations of spells and abilities without relying on traditional land cards. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and control the board while setting up win conditions through cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Goblin Charbelcher. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, artifact tutoring, and disruptive plays, the deck can surprise opponents and quickly close out games. Its unique approach to generating mana and card advantage makes it a challenging and unpredictable opponent in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing a combination of disruption spells such as Thoughtseize and Counterspell, removal spells like Fatal Push, and creatures like Abhorrent Oculus to control the board. Strategic Betrayal and Tainted Indulgence provide additional ways to gain control of the game, while cards like Murktide Regent and Ketramose, the New Dawn offer late-game win conditions. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy, disrupt their resources, and ultimately out-value them in the long run to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, supported by removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending. It also has disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Arena of Glory to disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck also has a mix of card advantage and card selection with Consign to Memory and Ephemerate. The overall strategy is to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their plans to gain advantage and close out the game quickly.
